page.title: 20BUILDINGS - MINCHINHAMPTON
page.content: {Minchinhampton Market House}was built in 1700 by Philip Shepperd. In 1913 Lt Col H G Ricardo gave it to the town as a gift. Originally there were three market houses in Minchinhampton. One of the others was in the centre of the town and was replaced by the War Memorial when it was demolished in 1919. The site of the third market house is unknown. The{church}dates from the fourteenth century but it was much "restored" in 1842. It has a very good 14th Century window in the South Transept. The church contains brasses and medieval tombs. The graveyard contains table-top tombs. {Park Terrace}was built in 1833 for estate workers of Gatcombe Estate (now the home of Princess Anne), and was sold at the turn of the century.
